title: Ticket #5994: Use PIE for benchmarks
description: Debian is going to use address randomization for all executables. So, they must be compiled with -fPIE. We already compile with -fPIC for most of our code. However, our benchmarks (mips and kflops) use -fno-PIC because of the severe performance impact. -fno-PIC implies -fno-PIE. The Debian project requires -fPIE for inclusion in Debian 9. So, we will add -fPIE to the benchmarks. This has minimal performance impact. mips reports 2.5% slower, kflops reports 0.1% slower.
